body_html:
Actually I was just trying a simple pytorch to caffe2 test, documented here
https://github.com/onnx/tutorials/blob/master/tutorials/CorrectnessVerificationAndPerformanceComparison.ipynb

I experienced a second issue with
caffe2_time = benchmark_caffe2_model(init_net, predict_net)

The error was

RuntimeError: [enforce fail at operator.cc:46] blob != nullptr. op Conv: Encountered a non-existing input blob: 0

which appears to be caused by the fact that benchmark_caffe2_model creates a new workspace and tries to call ws.CreateNet(init_net) without passing in any input blobs.

which appears to be caused by the fact that benchmark_caffe2_model creates a new workspace and tries to call ws.CreateNet(init_net) without passing in any input blobs.
body:
Actually I was just trying a simple pytorch to caffe2 test, documented here
https://github.com/onnx/tutorials/blob/master/tutorials/CorrectnessVerificationAndPerformanceComparison.ipynb

I experienced a second issue with 
`caffe2_time = benchmark_caffe2_model(init_net, predict_net)`

The error was 
```
RuntimeError: [enforce fail at operator.cc:46] blob != nullptr. op Conv: Encountered a non-existing input blob: 0
```
which appears to be caused by the fact that `benchmark_caffe2_model` creates a new workspace and tries to call `ws.CreateNet(init_net)` without passing in any input blobs.
